text: The book of 1 Chronicles begins with a genealogy tracing back to whom?
verseText: Adam, Seth, Enosh;

text: Which son of Noah is the ancestor of the Israelites listed in the genealogies?
verseText: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech. Arpachshad fathered Shelah; and Shelah fathered Eber. Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah.

text: Who is listed as the father of the Israelites (Jacob)?
verseText: Abraham fathered Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.

text: How many sons did Jacob (Israel) have, whose descendants became the tribes?
verseText: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, Asher.

text: From which son of Jacob did King David descend?
verseText: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah; these three Bath-shua the Canaanite bore to him. Now Er, Judah's firstborn, was evil in the sight of the LORD, and he put him to death. His daughter-in-law Tamar also bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all. The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul. The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara, five in all. The son of Carmi: Achan, the troubler of Israel, who broke faith in the matter of the devoted thing; and Ethan's son was Azariah. The sons of Hezron that were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai. Ram fathered Amminadab, and Amminadab fathered Nahshon, prince of the sons of Judah. Nahshon fathered Salmon, Salmon fathered Boaz, Boaz fathered Obed, Obed fathered Jesse. Jesse fathered Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third, Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth, Ozem the sixth, David the seventh.

text: Who was David's father?
verseText: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh.

text: Which tribe is known for producing the priests?
verseText: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

text: Who was the first king of Israel mentioned dying at the beginning of David's reign narrative in 1 Chronicles?
verseText: So Saul died for his breach of faith. He broke faith with the LORD in that he did not keep the command of the LORD, and also consulted a medium, seeking guidance. He did not seek guidance from the LORD. Therefore the LORD put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.

text: Why did Saul die, according to 1 Chronicles 10?
options: For his unfaithfulness to the LORD and consulting a medium
verseText: So Saul died for his breach of faith. He broke faith with the LORD in that he did not keep the command of the LORD, and also consulted a medium, seeking guidance.

text: Where was David officially anointed king over all Israel?
verseText: Then all Israel gathered together to David at Hebron and said, 'Behold, we are your bone and flesh. In times past, even when Saul was king, it was you who led out and brought in Israel. And the LORD your God said to you, You shall be shepherd of my people Israel, and you shall be prince over my people Israel.' So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them at Hebron before the LORD, and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.

text: Which city did David capture from the Jebusites and make his capital?
verseText: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, that is, Jebus, where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land. The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, 'You will not come in here.' Nevertheless, David took the stronghold of Zion, that is, the city of David.

text: What important sacred object did David decide to bring to Jerusalem?
options: The Ark of God (Ark of the Covenant)
verseText: Then let us bring again the ark of our God to us, for we did not seek it in the days of Saul.

text: Who died tragically when he touched the Ark during its first attempted transport?
verseText: And when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah put out his hand to take hold of the ark, for the oxen stumbled. And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he put out his hand to the ark, and he died there before God.

text: In whose house did the Ark stay for three months, bringing blessing?
verseText: So David did not take the ark home into the city of David, but took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite. And the ark of God remained with the household of Obed-edom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the household of Obed-edom and all that he had.

text: Who were designated as the only ones permitted to carry the Ark of God?
verseText: Then David said, 'No one may carry the ark of God except the Levites, for the LORD chose them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister to him forever.'

text: How was the Ark transported successfully the second time?
options: Carried on the shoulders of the Levites using poles
Pulled by oxen led by priests
verseText: And the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded according to the word of the LORD.

text: What was David doing as the Ark entered Jerusalem, which caused his wife Michal to despise him?
verseText: And as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David dancing and celebrating, and she despised him in her heart.

text: David desired to build what for the LORD?
verseText: Now when David lived in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, 'Behold, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent.'

text: Who did the LORD, through Nathan the prophet, say would build the Temple?
verseText: When your days are fulfilled to walk with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build a house for me...

text: Why was David not permitted to build the Temple?
options: He was a man of war and had shed much blood
verseText: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 'You have shed much blood and have waged great wars. You shall not build a house to my name, because you have shed so much blood before me on the earth.'

text: What did David spend much of his later reign doing in preparation for the Temple?
verseText: David commanded to gather together the resident aliens... He also provided great quantities of iron... bronze... cedar timbers... David said, 'Solomon my son is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent... I will therefore make preparation for it.' So David provided materials in great quantity before his death.

text: Which son did David designate as his successor to the throne?
verseText: When David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.

text: David organized the Levites into groups for various tasks including serving in the Temple, singing, and what other key role?
verseText: The Levites, thirty years old and upward, were counted... 24,000 were to oversee the work of the house of the LORD, 6,000 were officers and judges, 4,000 were gatekeepers, and 4,000 were praising the LORD with instruments...

text: Who was the primary leader of the Temple musicians appointed by David?
verseText: Then he appointed some of the Levites as ministers before the ark of the LORD... Asaph was the chief...

text: What sin did David commit by ordering a census of Israel, which angered the LORD?
options: Numbering the fighting men (incited by Satan/adversary)
verseText: Then Satan stood against Israel and incited David to number Israel. So David said to Joab and the commanders... 'Go, number Israel...' But Joab said, '...Why should he bring guilt on Israel?'

text: What were the three choices of punishment offered to David for his sinful census?
options: Three years of famine, three months of fleeing enemies, or three days of pestilence
verseText: So Gad came to David and said to him, 'Thus says the LORD, Choose what you will: either three years of famine, or three months of devastation by your foes... or else three days of the sword of the LORD, pestilence on the land...'

text: Which punishment did David choose?
verseText: Then David said to Gad, 'I am in great distress. Let me fall into the hand of the LORD, for his mercy is very great, but do not let me fall into the hand of man.'

text: Where did the plague stop, after David offered a sacrifice?
options: The threshing floor of Ornan (Araunah) the Jebusite
verseText: And God sent the angel to Jerusalem to destroy it... And the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite... Then the angel of the LORD commanded Gad to say to David that David should go up and raise an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan...

text: What significant site would later be built on the location of Ornan's threshing floor?
verseText: Then David said, 'Here shall be the house of the LORD God and here the altar of burnt offering for Israel.' (2 Chron 3:1 confirms Solomon built it there)

text: In his final address, what did David charge Solomon and the leaders of Israel to do?
options: Seek wisdom and build the Temple
verseText: 'And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart... for the LORD searches all hearts... If you seek him, he will be found by you... Be careful now, for the LORD has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong and do it.'... 'Be strong and courageous and do it. Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed, for the LORD God, even my God, is with you.'

text: Besides David, which other two sons of Jesse are specifically mentioned as having daughters?
options: No other sons are mentioned with daughters
verseText: And their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three. Abigail bore Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite. (Zeruiah and Abigail are Jesse's daughters/David's sisters)

text: Achar (or Achan) from the tribe of Judah is mentioned for bringing disaster upon Israel. What was his specific sin (detailed in Joshua 7)?
verseText: The son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who broke faith in the matter of the devoted things.

text: Who was the father of Caleb (son of Hezron, distinct from Caleb son of Jephunneh)?
verseText: Caleb the son of Hezron fathered children by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth...

text: Which group among the Levites were the descendants of Aaron, designated for the priesthood?
verseText: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar... But Aaron and his sons made offerings... for all the work of the Most Holy Place...

text: Which tribe is noted for its skilled archers and warriors who could use both the right and left hand?
verseText: They were bowmen and could shoot arrows and sling stones with either the right or the left hand; they were Benjaminites, Saul's kinsmen.

text: Jashobeam, Eleazar, and Shammah were known collectively as what?
options: The Three (most prominent of David's mighty men)
verseText: This is the list of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam... And next to him among the three mighty men was Eleazar... (Shammah is included in 2 Samuel's account of The Three)

text: What feat is attributed to Jashobeam the Hachmonite, chief of the Three?
options: Killing a lion in a pit on a snowy day
Wielding his spear against 300 or 800 men at one time
Bringing water from the well of Bethlehem
verseText: ...Jashobeam, a Hachmonite, chief of the three. He wielded his spear against 300 whom he killed at one time. (Note: Number varies between 300 in Chron and 800 in 2 Sam)

text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada, one of David's mighty men, was famous for striking down what impressive foes?
options: Two ariel-like champions of Moab, a lion, and a formidable Egyptian
verseText: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was a valiant man... he struck down the two heroes of Moab. He also went down and struck down a lion in a pit on a day when snow had fallen. And he struck down an Egyptian...

text: Which king of Tyre sent cedar, carpenters, and masons to build David a palace?
verseText: And Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, also masons and carpenters to build a house for him.

text: After defeating the Philistines at Baal-perazim, what did David call the place, meaning 'The Lord has broken through'?
verseText: And they came up to Baal-perazim, and David struck them down there. And David said, 'God has broken through my enemies by my hand, like a bursting flood.' Therefore the name of that place is called Baal-perazim.

text: Who were the chief Levites appointed by David to oversee the music when the Ark was brought to Jerusalem?
verseText: David also commanded the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their brothers as the singers who should play loudly on musical instruments... So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brothers Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari, their brothers, Ethan the son of Kushaiah. (Ethan is also called Jeduthun)

text: The Psalm of Thanksgiving David delivered to Asaph in 1 Chronicles 16 is composed of sections from which other Psalms?
verseText: Compare 1 Chron 16:8-22 with Ps 105:1-15; 1 Chron 16:23-33 with Ps 96:1-13; 1 Chron 16:34-36 with Ps 106:1, 47-48

text: What promise regarding David's lineage is central to the Davidic Covenant outlined in 1 Chronicles 17?
options: His sons would be great warriors
His kingdom and throne would be established forever
His family would always be wealthy
verseText: He shall build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever... I will confirm him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne shall be established forever.

text: David defeated Hadadezer, king of which Aramean kingdom, capturing chariots and horsemen?
verseText: David also defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah-Hamath, as he went to set up his monument at the river Euphrates.

text: From which conquered cities of Hadadezer did David take a large amount of bronze that Solomon later used for the Temple?
verseText: And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a large amount of bronze. With it Solomon made the bronze sea and the pillars and the vessels of bronze.

text: Which Ammonite king insulted David's envoys by shaving off half their beards and cutting their garments?
verseText: Now after this Nahash the king of the Ammonites died... So David sent messengers... But the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun... Hanun took David's servants and shaved them and cut off their garments in the middle... and sent them away.

text: Who was the commander of David's army who led the siege against Rabbah of the Ammonites?
verseText: In the spring of the year... Joab led out the army and ravaged the country of the Ammonites and came and besieged Rabbah. But David remained at Jerusalem. And Joab struck down Rabbah and overthrew it.

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, one of David's men, is credited with killing which Philistine giant?
verseText: And after this there arose war with the Philistines at Gezer. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite struck down Sippai, who was one of the descendants of the giants...

text: Elhanan son of Jair is credited in 1 Chronicles with killing whom?
options: A giant with six fingers on each hand
Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite
verseText: And there was again war with the Philistines, and Elhanan the son of Jair struck down Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite...

text: What physical characteristic distinguished the giant slain by Jonathan, David's nephew, at Gath?
options: Six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot
verseText: And there was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in number, and he also was descended from the giants. (ESV)

text: Why did David insist on paying Ornan the full price for his threshing floor, oxen, and wheat?
options: David refused to offer the LORD that which cost him nothing
verseText: But King David said to Ornan, 'No, but I will buy them for the full price. I will not take for the LORD what is yours, nor offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.'

text: How much gold did David specify he had set aside for the 'house of the LORD' in his preparations?
verseText: With great pains I have provided for the house of the LORD 100,000 talents of gold, a million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weighing...

text: At what age were the Levites counted for service according to David's final command (a change from the earlier requirement)?
verseText: These were the sons of Levi by their fathers' houses... those enrolled from twenty years old and upward... For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered from twenty years old and upward.

text: How many divisions were the priests (sons of Aaron) organized into for Temple service?
verseText: The divisions of the sons of Aaron were these... they divided them by lot... sixteen heads of fathers' houses of the sons of Eleazar, and eight of the sons of Ithamar... The twenty-fourth was to Maaziah. These had as their appointed duty...

text: What instruments were the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun designated to play while prophesying?
verseText: David and the chiefs of the service also set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied with lyres, with harps, and with cymbals.

text: How many divisions of gatekeepers were established?
options: There were specific families, not numbered divisions like the priests/musicians
verseText: As for the divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites... Meshelemiah the son of Kore... Obed-edom also had sons... (Lists families and responsibilities by gate, not 24 divisions)

text: Besides guarding the gates, what other responsibility did certain Levite families under Obed-edom have?
verseText: And of the Levites, Ahijah had charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries of the dedicated gifts... this Shebuel son of Gershom, son of Moses, was chief officer in charge of the treasuries.

text: David organized the army into how many monthly divisions, each serving for one month a year?
verseText: This is the number of the people of Israel... the commanders of thousands and hundreds... who served the king in all matters concerning the divisions that came and went, month after month throughout the year, each division numbering 24,000.

text: Who was David's uncle, known as a counselor, a man of understanding, and a scribe?
verseText: Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, being a man of understanding and a scribe...

text: Who was commander of David's army?
verseText: After Ahithophel came Jehoiada the son of Benaiah and Abiathar. Joab was commander of the king's army.

text: What materials did David specifically list when urging the leaders and people to contribute willingly to the Temple?
options: Gold, silver, bronze, iron, wood, onyx stones, stones for setting, antimony, colored stones, all sorts of precious stones, and marble
verseText: So I have provided for the house of my God, so far as I was able, the gold... silver... bronze... iron... wood... onyx stones... stones for setting... antimony... colored stones... all sorts of precious stones... and marble.

text: How much personal gold and silver did David state he was donating from his private treasury?
verseText: 3,000 talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and 7,000 talents of refined silver...

text: What was the people's reaction to the generous giving towards the Temple?
options: They rejoiced with great joy because they gave willingly
verseText: Then the people rejoiced because they had given willingly, for with a whole heart they had offered freely to the LORD. David the king also rejoiced greatly.

text: In David's prayer in 1 Chronicles 29, what does he acknowledge about wealth and honor?
verseText: Both riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all. In your hand are power and might, and in your hand it is to make great and to give strength to all.

text: How long did David reign over Israel in total (combining time in Hebron and Jerusalem)?
verseText: The time that he reigned over Israel was forty years. He reigned seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

text: Which three prophetic sources are mentioned at the end of 1 Chronicles as containing the records of King David's reign?
options: Samuel the seer, Nathan the prophet, Gad the seer
verseText: Now the acts of King David, from first to last, are written in the Chronicles of Samuel the seer, and in the Chronicles of Nathan the prophet, and in the Chronicles of Gad the seer...

text: Who were the three sons of Zeruiah, David's sister, famous as military leaders?
verseText: And their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.

text: Who is listed as the firstborn son of Reuben who lost his birthright?
verseText: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father's couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph...)... The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

text: To which son of Joseph was the birthright (double portion) effectively given, though Judah received the leadership?
options: It wasn't specified as given to Joseph's sons in 1 Chron 5
verseText: ...his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, so that he could not be enrolled as the oldest son; though Judah became strong among his brothers and a chief came from him, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph. (Ephraim typically received the preeminence associated with the birthright among Joseph's sons).

text: Beerah, a prince of the Reubenites, was carried away captive by which Assyrian king?
verseText: Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria carried away into exile; he was a chief of the Reubenites.

text: The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh were defeated and exiled because they 'broke faith' and 'played the whore' with the gods of which peoples?
options: Peoples of the land whom God had destroyed before them
verseText: But they broke faith with the God of their fathers, and whored after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

text: Which high priest served at the time the Ark was brought into Solomon's Temple (mentioned in the genealogies)?
verseText: Johanan fathered Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem).

text: Shubael, descended from Moses' son Gershom, held what important position under David?
verseText: And Shebuel the son of Gershom, son of Moses, was chief officer in charge of the treasuries. (Note: Shebuel and Shubael often refer to the same person)

text: The list of mighty men who came to David at Ziklag includes warriors from which tribe, surprisingly, given it was Saul's own tribe?
verseText: Now these were the men who came to David at Ziklag... They were bowmen and could shoot arrows... with either the right or the left hand; they were Benjaminites, Saul's kinsmen.

text: Certain Gadite warriors who joined David were described with what fierce imagery?
options: Faces like the faces of lions, swift as gazelles on mountains
Wise as serpents, innocent as doves
verseText: From the Gadites there went over to David at the stronghold in the wilderness mighty and experienced warriors... whose faces were like the faces of lions and who were swift as gazelles upon the mountains.

text: Amasai, chief of the 'Thirty' (or captains), spoke under the Spirit when pledging allegiance to David. What was his key affirmation?
options: 'We are yours, O David, and with you!'
verseText: Then the Spirit clothed Amasai, chief of the thirty, and he said, 'We are yours, O David, and with you, O son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, and peace to your helpers! For your God helps you.' Then David received them...

text: Which tribe provided the largest contingent of soldiers (120,000) when David was made king at Hebron?
verseText: And from the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites and Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, 120,000, armed with all the weapons of war.

text: The men of which tribe were noted for 'understanding the times, to know what Israel ought to do'?
verseText: Of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, 200 chiefs, and all their kinsmen under their command.

text: What objects did David and Israel burn after the Philistines abandoned them following their defeat at Baal-perazim?
verseText: And they left their gods there, and David commanded them to be burned.

text: Which two specific Levites were designated as the chief priests before the Ark in Jerusalem and the Tabernacle at Gibeon, respectively?
verseText: So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark... to minister regularly... And he left Zadok the priest and his brothers the priests before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon...

text: David's census was incited by 'Satan' in 1 Chronicles 21. How does the parallel account in 2 Samuel 24 describe the source of the incitement?
verseText: Then Satan stood against Israel and incited David to number Israel. (2 Sam 24:1 says 'Again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he incited David against them, saying, Go, number Israel and Judah.')

text: How many shekels of gold did David pay Ornan for the threshing floor site (not just the oxen/wheat for the immediate sacrifice)?
verseText: So David paid Ornan 600 shekels of gold by weight for the site. (Note: 2 Sam 24:24 mentions 50 shekels of silver, often thought to be for the oxen and threshing floor implements only, while 1 Chron gives the price for the entire site.)

text: Where was the Tabernacle of Moses and the altar of burnt offering located during the latter part of David's reign, preventing David from inquiring there after the census?
verseText: For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.

text: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was skillful in what specific area related to the Ark's transport?
verseText: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of lifting up the voice (or singing/transport); he instructed about the lifting up the voice because he was skillful.

text: Shelomoth and his brothers, descendants of Moses through Eliezer, had charge over what specific items?
options: All the dedicated gifts consecrated by David and his commanders
verseText: His brothers: from Eliezer were his son Rehabiah... Shelomoth and his brothers were in charge of all the treasuries of the dedicated gifts that David the king... had dedicated.

text: Which two Levites were appointed as officers and judges 'for all the work of the LORD and for the service of the king' west of the Jordan?
options: Hashabiah and his brothers (1,700 men of valor)
verseText: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, 1,700 men of valor, had the oversight of Israel westward of the Jordan for all the work of the LORD and for the service of the king.

text: Jerijah, a descendant of Hebron, was found to be chief of the Hebronites according to genealogies in which specific year of David's reign?
verseText: Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was the chief... In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought out, and mighty men of valor were found among them at Jazer in Gilead.

text: Who was over the king's treasures (not the temple's)?
verseText: Over the king's treasuries was Azmaveth the son of Adiel...

text: Who was David's seer (prophet)?
verseText: And the LORD spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying...

text: Who was David's 'friend' or chief advisor listed after Ahithophel?
verseText: Ahithophel was the king's counselor, and Hushai the Archite was the king's friend.

text: How many talents of gold did the leaders of Israel (princes, commanders, officials) contribute for the work of the Temple?
verseText: Then the leaders of fathers' houses made their freewill offerings... They gave for the service of the house of God 5,000 talents... of gold, 10,000 talents of silver...

text: Who is listed as the father of Saul, the first king?
verseText: Ner fathered Kish, Kish fathered Saul, Saul fathered Jonathan...

text: Which son of Saul survived and had descendants listed in the Benjaminite genealogy?
verseText: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal (Mephibosheth); and Merib-baal fathered Micah.

text: The genealogies in chapter 9 list the first inhabitants returning to Jerusalem after the exile primarily from which tribes?
verseText: So all Israel was enrolled by genealogies... And the first to dwell again in their property in their cities were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the temple servants. And some of the people of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem.

text: What specific duty was assigned to the Kohathite Levites Mattithiah, Shallum, and their brothers regarding the Temple offerings?
options: Preparing the bread of the Presence (showbread)
verseText: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the baking of the flat cakes. Also some of their brothers of the Kohathites had charge of the rows of bread (showbread) to prepare them every Sabbath.

text: What was the name of Joab's armor-bearer who is also listed among David's mighty men?
verseText: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
